medical_history.chief_complaint: Painful swellings and asymptomatic 'warts' on the right lower leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The swellings had been present for 10 years. The 'warts' developed within the previous year and were gradually increasing in number. The patient described intense pain of the right calf during walking or exercise.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Excision of a lipoma and hypertrophic tonsils and adenoid vegetation with open-mouth breathing. Diagnosis of neurofibromatosis.
medical_history.family_history: Macrocephaly in the brother and maternal uncle; cutaneous lipomatosis in the mother.
